And thereâs nothing wrong with that, so long as you remember that itâs a feeling, not a fact. So long as you remember that that feeling is best, is most powerful, when it is shared.

How dare you, OP on the bottom right. How can you sayâscreamâ"no, itâs not allowed to be your thing, go away" of fuckingÂ The Perks of Being a Wallflower?Â Have you READ Perks? Because far as I can tell, that novel (and movie!) is all about the intimacy and necessity of inclusiveness. Itâs about how weâre all broken inside, all desperate, all searching for a family to call our own. For people who will love us for our jagged edges; people whose own jagged edges fit against ours like puzzle pieces. Itâs about finding the beauty in mediocrity, in discoveringÂ moreÂ in people than you ever thought they could give you.

HowÂ dareÂ you tell anyone they donât get to be a part of that? How dare you tell them that because of what they likeâflower crowns, Instagram filters, a pair of broken shoelaces and a caption in Helveticaâtheyâre somehow lesser, different, not allowed. Cut off.

How dare you make yourself gatekeeper?

So youâre right, OP on the top, who in a fugue of almost self-awareness tagged your post âthis makes me angrier than it should.â Because bow ties donât belong to the Whovians, they donât belong to anyone, and they donât because theyâreÂ fucking bow ties.Â Theyâve been a menswear accessory staple for a decent fewÂ centuries.Â Matt Smith has been the Doctor sinceÂ April of 2010.Â It doesnât belong to you; itâs not yours. Lord knows you canât justÂ likeÂ something. You have to be in The Club.

to any of you

that if you walk up to someone who doesnât seem to know her way around and you say âHey, I notice youâve only highlighted that one quote, yâknow, the one about being infinite, and I was wondering why it spoke to you? And do you want to talk about the other parts?â you might
